basics.name: Muhammed Patel
basics.label: MaSc Candidate
basics.summary: A passionate engineer specializing in Systems Design Engineering with a keen interest in Computer Vision, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning

courses: Thesis: Whale detection from Aerial images

education.area: Industrial Engineering with micro specialization in Optimization theory and Applications
courses: Thesis: Gym exercises posture correction using Computer Vision

work.name: Philips Innovation Campus, Philips India Limited
highlights: Enhanced the quality of MRI image annotations by manually revising over 184 images, achieving higher inter-annotator agreement.
Improved deep learning model performance by 45% through realistic data augmentation for 3D Brain MRI images using TorchIO.
Boosted software quality with unit testing and debugging, conducted a literature survey on active learning algorithms, and developed a customizable PyTorch framework for models and datasets.

work.name: under Prof. Panagiotis Kalnis, Computer Science | King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST), Saudi Arabia
highlights: Simulated a federated learning environment in PyTorch to train models on decentralized edge devices without data exchange, ensuring data privacy.
Reduced communication bottlenecks by implementing lossy compression schemes on local models during client-server communications.
Implemented and benchmarked the state-of-the-art Compressed Loopless Gradient Descent (L2GD) algorithm on real datasets.

projects.name: Foundation model for SAR imagery
highlights: Developed a foundation model using Masked autoencoders on SAR images using large amounts of SAR data

projects.name: AutoIce Competition
highlights: Developed a multi-task UNet model which won the first place in the Autoice competition hosted by the European Space Agency (ESA)
This work was published in the Cryosphere journal

projects.name: Pixel level segmentation from Region level labels
highlights: Developed a novel loss function that facilitates the training of pixel-level segmentation models using only region-level labels, bypassing the need for labor-intensive pixel-wise annotation
This method outperforms the Auto ICE competition model and has significantly better accuracy(12% average) for minority classes
This work was published at ICLR2024 in ML4RS

projects.name: Whale detection from Large Aerial Images
highlights: Developed an innovative training pipeline tailored for small object detection, achieving an impressive 90% precision and recall rate
Shipped the model into production using Labelstudio with a support for online learning. This framework is currently used by the DFO (Fisheries and Oceans Canada)

selected publications.name: Region-Level Labels in Ice Charts Can Produce Pixel-Level Segmentation for Sea Ice Types
selected publications.publisher: In Proceedings of the ICLR 2024 Machine Learning for Remote Sensing (ML4RS) Workshop
selected publications.summary: We introduce a novel loss function to enable learning from regional labels to produce pixel-level segmentations. Leveraging the AI4Arctic Sea Ice Challenge Dataset, our method outperforms the fully supervised U-Net benchmark, the top solution of the AutoIce challenge

selected publications.name: MMSeaIce: a collection of techniques for improving sea ice mapping with a multi-task model
selected publications.summary: In this work we outline the solution that helped us win the AutoIce competition organised by European Space Agengy (ESA)

selected publications.name: Simulating Realistic MRI variations to Improve Deep Learning model and visual explanations using GradCAM.
selected publications.summary: To overcome limited data availability, we implement realistic data augmentation to generate synthetic 3D volumetric data and Grad-CAM to visualize the model's prediction

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Lalit Chugh and Hira Ahuja International Graduate Scholarship
